a_song_and_a_beer.title: A Song and a Beer
a_song_and_a_beer.lyrics:
Verse 1
Dive bar buzzing, the city's aglow,
Playlist spinning songs we all know.
Bartender smiling, hands me a drink,
Tonight’s for forgetting, no time to think.
Pre-Chorus
Wearing life's marks, but the road stays clear,
All we need is good company and beer.
Chorus
Give me a song and a beer, let the music play low,
Sing me a story everybody knows.
Through highs and lows, we find comfort right here,
Life’s always better with a song and a beer.
Verse 2
We share our laughter, let the heartaches unwind,
Melodies lifting our hearts and our minds.
Raise a toast to the good times we've had,
Tonight’s for the living, not feeling sad.
Pre-Chorus
Life leaves its marks, but our spirits stay clear,
Gathered together with music and beer.
Chorus
Give me a song and a beer, let the music play low,
Sing me a story everybody knows.
Through highs and lows, we find comfort right here,
Life’s always better with a song and a beer.
Bridge
Every lyric’s a memory, each chorus our bond,
Friendship and freedom, the music rolls on.
This place isn’t just bricks, it’s a feeling inside,
Stories unfolding beneath city lights.
Chorus
Give me a song and a beer, let the music play low,
Sing me a story everybody knows.
Through highs and lows, we find comfort right here,
Life’s always better with a song and a beer.
Outro
Lift a glass to the night, watch the worries disappear,
Everything’s alright with a song and a beer.

my_mothers_eyes.title: My Mother’s Eyes
my_mothers_eyes.lyrics:
Verse 1
Never knew your smile, never heard your call,
Just a faded photo on a cracked bedroom wall.
But when the mirror catches me in the morning’s glare,
I see your fire burnin’, and I know you’re there.
Pre-Chorus
You gave me your spirit when you gave me my life,
Your love’s in my blood, sharper than a knife.
Chorus
She never heard my first cry, never wiped my fears,
But her face stares back in my morning mirror.
The love I never touched still paints my skies —
I was born with my mother’s eyes.
Verse 2
Dad said I killed you, but I feel you near,
In the songs I sing, in the dreams that appear.
Your strength’s in my hands when I strum through the pain,
Your heart’s in my chest when I’m walkin’ through rain.
Pre-Chorus
You left me your courage when you left this earth,
I’m livin’ your love in the songs of my birth.
Chorus
She never heard my first cry, never wiped my fears,
But her face stares back in my morning mirror.
The love I never touched still paints my skies —
I was born with my mother’s eyes.
Bridge
Every note’s a letter to the mother I’ve known,
Every chord’s a root in the seeds you’ve sown.
You’re the light in my darkness, the truth in my cries,
I’m carryin’ your love in my mother’s eyes.
Chorus
She never heard my first cry, never wiped my fears,
But her face stares back in my morning mirror.
The love I never touched still paints my skies —
I was born with my mother’s eyes.
Outro
*(Slow picking: E|-3---3---|)*
My mother’s eyes… my heart’s only light.

the_mourning_after.title: The Mourning After
the_mourning_after.lyrics:
Verse 1
Woke up to a headache and your face in my mind,
That video call still burns like cheap red wine.
I torched your old photos in a rusted tin can,
But your laugh keeps echoin’ through this broken man.
Pre-Chorus
I’m half-dead, but I’m fightin’ to breathe,
Tradin’ tears for the strength to believe.
Chorus
The mournin’ after’s a cold, lonesome fight,
Scrapin’ up my heart in the pale morning light.
I’m chasin’ new shadows where your ghost don’t roam,
Findin’ my way, but I ain’t yet home.
Verse 2
New bar down the highway, new smoke in the air,
A girl’s crooked smile says she don’t know my care.
I’m shakin’ off the weight of your cheatin’ disguise,
But your voice still cuts through the neon-lit skies.
Pre-Chorus
I’m not healed, but I’m startin’ to mend,
Carvin’ out a road where your lies gotta end.
Chorus
The mournin’ after’s a cold, lonesome fight,
Scrapin’ up my heart in the pale morning light.
I’m chasin’ new shadows where your ghost don’t roam,
Findin’ my way, but I ain’t yet home.
Bridge
Every mile I drive, I bury you deeper in the dust,
Every shot I take, I’m weldin’ back my trust.
Your love was a blade that cut me to the core,
But I’m stitchin’ up my soul, I don’t need you no more.
Chorus
The mournin’ after’s a cold, lonesome fight,
Scrapin’ up my heart in the pale morning light.
I’m chasin’ new shadows where your ghost don’t roam,
Findin’ my way, but I ain’t yet home.
Outro
New dives, new dawns, new battles to win,
The mournin’ after’s where I’m learnin’ to begin.
*(Slow picking: E|-3---3---|)*
Mournin’ after you… I’m startin’ again.

hollow_turns_hallelujah.title: Hollow Turns Hallelujah
hollow_turns_hallelujah.lyrics:
Hollow Turns Hallelujah
Verse 1
Boot prints fading, desert moon hanging low
Guard duty whispers, stories we all know
Chopper blades turning, a melancholic drone
The campfire's out, brothers gone, too soon flown
Verse 2
We built our bunkers, sandbags stacked up high
Dreamed of homecomings 'neath a foreign sky
Shared our rations, stories raw and true
Now the echoes fade, a future we couldn't view
Chorus
But the hollow turns hallelujah, in the quiet of the years
A symphony of service, washed away by bittersweet tears
We raise our voices, cracked and worn, a campfire choir once more
Singin' hymns of resilience, from the scars that we bore
Verse 3
Rifle shots echo, a bugle out of tune
Forgotten faces flicker beneath the desert moon
The camaraderie lingers, a ghost in the desert air
A reminder of courage, a burden that we share
Bridge
We scattered like shrapnel, on the winds of war we flew
Chasing a mission's purpose, some lost, some seeing it through
But the bonds run deep, beneath the surface they reside
Bound by the campfire's glow, where our brothers' spirits abide
Chorus
And the hollow turns hallelujah, in the quiet of the years
A symphony of service, washed away by bittersweet tears
We raise our voices, cracked and worn, a campfire choir once more
Singin' hymns of resilience, from the scars that we bore
Outro
Hallelujah, hallelujah, from the hollow we rise
Hallelujah, hallelujah, with strength in our eyes
The campfire's memory burns, a beacon in the night
Guiding us home, bathing our souls in its light.
Hallelujah.

lantern_i_left_behind.title: Lantern I Left Behind
lantern_i_left_behind.lyrics:
Lantern I Left Behind
(Verse 1)
Sunrise spills across the ridge, paints the valley gold
Another day breaks on this farm, a story left untold
Of restless nights and whispered dreams beneath a moonless sky
And the lantern I left burning low, the night you said goodbye.
The crickets chirped a lonely tune, the wind sighed through the trees
I watched your shadow disappear, carried on the breeze.
(Chorus)
Lantern I left behind, a flickering ember glow
A beacon in the darkness, watchin' where you go
A fragile flame against the dawn, a hope I couldn't keep
Just a memory now, a promise I couldn't sleep.
(Verse 2)
The rooster crows, a mournful sound, echoes through the air
Another day to plow these fields, another burden to bear
The coffee's strong and bitter black, like the taste in my mouth now
Remember how we used to laugh, beneath the apple bough?
We carved our initials in the bark, swore it'd always be
But time and distance took their toll, and stole you away from me.
(Bridge)
Maybe someday down the road, our paths will cross again
Maybe someday I'll understand, and forgive the hurt and pain
Maybe someday the lantern's light won't sting my eyes so bright
Maybe someday I'll find my peace, in the stillness of the night.
(Chorus)
Lantern I left behind, a flickering ember glow
A beacon in the darkness, watchin' where you go
A fragile flame against the dawn, a hope I couldn't keep
Just a memory now, a promise I couldn't sleep.
(Outro)
Just a memory now, a lantern I left behind
Burning in the morning light, a love I couldn't find.
Burning in the morning light…

morning_after_rain.title: Morning After Rain
morning_after_rain.lyrics:
Morning After Rain
(Verse 1)
Sunrise paints the valley gold, a mist hangs in the air
The creek bed whispers stories of the flood that raged through there
The earth drinks deep, the thirsty roots, reach down for grace anew
And I remember every tear, that washed over me and you
(Chorus)
Morning after rain, the scars begin to bloom
Wildflowers in the canyons, pushing through the gloom
Broken branches reach for light, a testament of will
Morning after rain, His mercy fills me still
(Verse 2)
The wind chimes sing a gentle song, a melody of peace
The broken fence post stands alone, a reminder grief will cease
The scent of honeysuckle sweet, a promise on the breeze
That even in the deepest hurt, there's solace in the trees
(Bridge)
I used to hide the broken parts, afraid to let them show
But every crack and every line, is how I learn to grow
The storm may rage, the thunder roar, but faith will see me through
'Cause even shattered pieces, can reflect the morning dew
(Chorus)
Morning after rain, the scars begin to bloom
Wildflowers in the canyons, pushing through the gloom
Broken branches reach for light, a testament of will
Morning after rain, His mercy fills me still
(Outro)
Morning after rain, the sun breaks through the clouds
Morning after rain, His love shouts out aloud.
Morning after rain.

red_dirt_road.title: Red Dirt Road
red_dirt_road.lyrics:
Red Dirt Road
(Verse 1)
Sunrise paints the cotton fields a hazy shade of gold
Another town I can't recall, another story told
Of a restless heart and wandering feet, a shadow in the night
Searching for a place to land, a flicker of guiding light
They call me outlaw, rebel soul, a drifter through and through
But beneath this hardened shell, a homesick heart beats true
(Chorus)
Red dirt road, windin' back to where I belong
Where the cypress trees stand tall and the mockingbird's sweet song
Echoes through the valleys, a memory so clear
Red dirt road, whisperin' "you're finally here"
(Verse 2)
Ran from the whispers, the judgment in their eyes
From the expectations heavy, beneath these southern skies
Thought I could outrun the past, the ghosts that held me down
But freedom's just a hollow word in every nameless town
Traded family for the highway, love for open space
Now I see the emptiness etched upon my weary face
(Bridge)
The asphalt ribbon stretched on, a promise never kept
Of something more, something different, a secret I had slept
With for too long, a restless dream that turned into a lie
Now I'm turnin' 'round, headin' back, beneath the open sky
(Chorus)
Red dirt road, windin' back to where I belong
Where the cypress trees stand tall and the mockingbird's sweet song
Echoes through the valleys, a memory so clear
Red dirt road, whisperin' "you're finally here"
(Outro)
Dust devils dancin' in the afternoon sun's glow
Red dirt road, takin' me home, slow and low
Yeah, takin' me home, slow and low.
Red dirt road, I'm finally home, I know.

scars_and_smoke.title: Scars and Smoke
scars_and_smoke.lyrics:
Verse 1
Sunrise bleeds red over coal-dust hills, another day’s begun,
Gravel crunches under boots, chasin’ a merciless sun.
Ain’t the life I dreamed, boy, ain’t the hand I aimed to draw,
But ghosts of broken yesterdays still claw me raw.
Pre-Chorus
No preacher’s words could save me, no bottle drowns the pain,
Just me and these old scars, walkin’ through the rain.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Verse 2
Highway’s a lonesome thread, gray as a miner’s grave,
Each mile a cut that memory’s blade never forgave.
Burned my bridges, paid in blood, for choices I can’t mend,
Huntin’ grace in ghost-town dust, where the lost roads end.
Pre-Chorus
No mercy in the mirror, just a boy who learned to fight,
Carvin’ truth from shattered years, under cold starlight.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Bridge
They say time stitches wounds, but mine still bleed and scream,
Echoes of a daddy’s fist haunt every damn dream.
I won’t let the dark win, won’t lay down and die,
Gonna claw toward that faint light, till I touch the sky.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Outro
*(Slow picking, low E drone)*
Just a flicker of peace tonight, under this lonesome moon so bright.
Scars and smoke, it’s all I’ve known,
Keep walkin’ these roads, till I call ‘em home.

faded_mountain_truths.title: Faded Mountain Truths
faded_mountain_truths.lyrics:
Title:  Faded Mountain Truths
(Verse 1)
Faded photographs in a dusty frame
Mama's smilin' face, ain't nothin' changed
'Cept the lines etched deeper, like the cracks on these hills
Years of worry and winters' chills
Daddy's shadow, a storm cloud gray
Hangin' heavy, never went away
Learned my lessons in the holler's shade
Mountain wisdom, hard earned and paid
(Chorus)
These mountains whisper secrets old and true
Tough as the roots that see 'em through
Like the wind that bends the pine so low
Gotta bend, not break, to weather the blow
Faded mountain truths, etched in stone
A legacy of hardship, a heart I call my own
(Verse 2)
Sixteen years, Blackberry Creek Road dust on my boots
Kicked out the door, nothin' but the clothes on my back, and a few faded roots
Found shelter in a tin can shack, leaks when it rained
Worked the fields, the mines, felt the body ache and pain
This broken arm, a constant reminder of his rage
But these calloused hands, they turned a new page
Found solace in the strings of a rusted guitar
Singin' my sorrows, beneath the evenin' star
(Bridge)
He tried to break me, spirit and bone
But the mountain in me wouldn't be overthrown
Like the coal that burns, a fire within
I rose from the ashes, learned to begin
(Chorus)
These mountains whisper secrets old and true
Tough as the roots that see 'em through
Like the wind that bends the pine so low
Gotta bend, not break, to weather the blow
Faded mountain truths, etched in stone
A legacy of hardship, a heart I call my own
(Outro)
Sun's comin' up, paintin' the sky gold
A new day breakin', a story yet untold
And though the shadows linger, I ain't afraid no more
Got faded mountain truths, to guide me to the shore.

hell_and_hymns.title: Hell and Hymns
hell_and_hymns.lyrics:
Verse 1
Friday night, under neon’s roar,
Whiskey’s pullin’ hard, settlin’ old scores.
Jukebox wails, hearts hit the floor,
Dancin’ through the haze, chasin’ something more.
Another week of grind, bones worn thin,
Sweat still burns where the work don’t end.
But tonight we’re alive, breakin’ every chain,
‘Til the sunrise lights the sky with flame.
Pre-Chorus
Runnin’ wild, but the soul’s still split,
Torn between the dark and the holy lit.
Chorus
Hell and hymns, we’re caught in the fray,
Whiskey sins, then we kneel to pray.
This heart keeps fightin’, searchin’ for release,
Between the devil’s fire and a savior’s peace.
Hell and hymns, our anthem’s cry,
Saturday’s rebellion, Sunday’s sky.
Risin’ from the ashes ‘neath a lonesome moon,
Lord, redeem these hands, scarred and strewn.
Verse 2
Guitar moans a lonesome plea,
Empty bottle spins, hauntin’ memories.
Found that six-string in a junkyard’s shine,
Strummed my soul where the wild winds whine.
Old man’s shadow still stalks my days,
His bitter words like a hell that stays.
But mama’s prayers, they pull me through,
Whisperin’ hope in the morning dew.
Pre-Chorus
Livin’ rough, but the heart holds strong,
Seekin’ light where the nights are long.
Chorus
Hell and hymns, we’re caught in the fray,
Whiskey sins, then we kneel to pray.
This heart keeps fightin’, searchin’ for release,
Between the devil’s fire and a savior’s peace.
Hell and hymns, our anthem’s cry,
Saturday’s rebellion, Sunday’s sky.
Risin’ from the ashes ‘neath a lonesome moon,
Lord, redeem these hands, scarred and strewn.
Bridge
No preacher’s verse, just a worker’s call,
Coal-dust dreams climbin’ past the fall.
Beggin’ for a spark to break the night,
From the shadows to salvation’s light.
Chorus
Hell and hymns, we’re caught in the fray,
Whiskey sins, then we kneel to pray.
This heart keeps fightin’, searchin’ for release,
Between the devil’s fire and a savior’s peace.
Hell and hymns, our anthem’s cry,
Saturday’s rebellion, Sunday’s sky.
Risin’ from the ashes ‘neath a lonesome moon,
Lord, redeem these hands, scarred and strewn.
Outro
*(Fiddle soar, steady strum)*
Hell and hymns, my soul’s still tried,
But I’m risin’ up where the heart don’t hide.
Amen.

when_you_cant_be_near_me.title: When You Can't Be Near Me
when_you_cant_be_near_me.lyrics:
(Verse 1) When you can't be near me, please think of me, I'm starin' at the highway, where you used to be. You're gone, my darlin', chasin' some new flame, But my heart's still ramblin', callin' out your name.
(Pre-Chorus) This whiskey's cold, it don't ease the pain, Without you here, I'm half insane.
(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Verse 2) I'm thumbin' through old photos, on this cracked phone screen, Your smile's a ghost now, in this lonesome scene. Got your voice in my head, like a steel guitar's cry, Keeps me holdin' on, beneath this empty sky.
(Pre-Chorus) The barstool's creakin', but it ain't my home, Without your touch, I'm destined to roam.
(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Bridge) So raise a glass, wherever you ride, Send a prayer on the wind, to the lonesome side. We'll cross paths again, down some dusty road, Till then, I'm carryin' this heavy load.
(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Outro) So when you're out there, under neon's glow, I'm still your rebel, in the shadows, you know. Till we're back together, where we're meant to be, When you can't be near me... please think of me. Yeah, think of me. (Oh, my lonesome soul.) Think of me.

backroad_heart.title: Backroad Heart
backroad_heart.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Out on County Road 9, where the gravel kicks dust,
We carved our initials in an oak, swore we’d never rust.
Your taillights faded, left me standin’ in the rain,
Now I’m chasin’ your memory, down a lonesome lane.
(Pre-Chorus)
This old truck’s still runnin’, but it’s fallin’ apart,
Just like me, it’s haulin’ this backroad heart.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Verse 2)
The radio’s playin’ that song you used to sing,
About a small-town dreamer, chasin’ bigger things.
I pass your mama’s porch light, it’s glowin’ soft and low,
Wish I could turn back time, to nights we used to know.
(Pre-Chorus)
This flannel’s worn thin, but I wear it with pride,
Like this backroad heart, still fightin’ for the ride.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Bridge)
Every cornfield sunrise, every starlit prayer,
I see your face in the distance, like you’re still right there.
I ain’t the kind to give up, I was raised to stand tall,
This backroad heart’s still beatin’, through the rise and fall.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Outro)
So I’ll drive these old backroads, till the pain departs,
Carrying the weight of this lonesome, backroad heart.
Yeah, this backroad heart… keeps rollin’ on.
Acoustic sound: Strong, steady acoustic guitar strum and simple, heartfelt vocals that emphasize the story's raw emotion. A gentle pedal steel or subtle fiddle melody weaves in and out, adding a layer of wistful nostalgia.

my_kentucky_heartbeat.title: My Kentucky Heartbeat
my_kentucky_heartbeat.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sunrise paints these Blue Ridge Mountains, but I'm already caked in mine grime
Another shift done, countin' pennies, losin' track of time.
This old pickup's my four walls now, under the Kentucky moon so wide
But thinkin' of your West Coast smile, girl, eases the ache inside.
(Chorus)
Hey, Shay, my Kentucky Heartbeat, my steady ground so true,
Miles can't change this rhythm I only find in you.
Every sunrise I fight for, every dollar I make,
Is for your California dream, no matter what it takes.
(Verse 2)
Remember Blackberry Creek, dust devils dancin' in the summer heat?
Felt like magic then, your hand in mine, oh, bitter and so sweet.
Now your picture on the dash, it guides me through the dark and lonely road
Helps me carry every burden, helps me lift this heavy load.
(Chorus)
Hey, Shay, my Kentucky Heartbeat, my steady ground so true,
Miles can't change this rhythm I only find in you.
Every sunrise I fight for, every dollar I make,
Is for your California dream, no matter what it takes.
(Bridge)
These calloused hands have known the sting of cold and burnin' steel
Played a rusted, found guitar, makin' all this heartache real.
But you heard the truth within the noise, a song beneath the pain
My Shay Bear, your belief in me, it washes off the stains.
(Chorus)
Hey, Shay, my Kentucky Heartbeat, my steady ground so true,
Miles can't change this rhythm I only find in you.
Every sunrise I fight for, every dollar I make,
Is for your California dream, no matter what it takes.
(Outro)
Yeah, my Kentucky Heartbeat, thumpin' just for you, Shay Bear. 
More than just some words, girl, this is my earnest prayer.
My truth, my song, for you

empty_seat.title: Empty Seat
empty_seat.lyrics:
Verse 1

Every mornin’ she’d slip through that diner door,

Same old booth, coffee black, nothin’ more.

Never spoke, just stared where the shadows creep,

Today her seat’s empty, and the silence cuts deep.

Chorus

Oh, the empty seat, where’d she go?

Carried her story where nobody knows.

A ghost in the booth, left a chill in the air,

Empty seat’s whisperin’, she ain’t there.

Verse 2

Worn-out coat, eyes like a lonesome rain,

No one asked her story, not even her name.

Waitress hums soft, but the counter feels wrong,

Her shadow’s gone quiet, where it used to belong.

Chorus

Oh, the empty seat, where’d she go?

Carried her story where nobody knows.

A ghost in the booth, left a chill in the air,

Empty seat’s whisperin’, she ain’t there.

Bridge

Was she runnin’ from hurt, or chasin’ a dream?

Lost in the cracks of a life’s frayed seam.

That booth holds her echo, a truth left unsaid,

A stranger’s gone missin’, but she ain’t dead.

Chorus

Oh, the empty seat, where’d she go?

Carried her story where nobody knows.

A ghost in the booth, left a chill in the air,

Empty seat’s whisperin’, she ain’t there.

Outro

In a small-town diner, ‘neath the hum of the light,

Her seat stays empty, through the long, lonesome night.

coal_dust_on_the_lamb.title: Coal Dust on the Lamb
coal_dust_on_the_lamb.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sixteen summers bleedin' into fall,
Daddy's shadow stretched across the wall.
His words like whiskey, burnin' down my throat,
Kicked me out to wander, wearin' a thin coat.
Pikeville hollers echoed with my shame,
Innocence a flicker, dyin' in the flame.

(Verse 2)
Found a floor to sleep on, kindness in a stranger's eye,
But the mountain cold seeped in, beneath a starless sky.
Traded school books for a pick and shovel's weight,
Coal dust settled on my dreams, sealin' up their fate.
This broken arm, a constant ache, a twisted memory,
Of a boy who used to dream beneath a dogwood tree.

(Chorus)
Coal dust on the lamb, a stain that won't come clean,
Lost my way back home, a forgotten, faded scene.
These coal-stained hands, they hold the weight of sin,
Prayin' for redemption, hopin' God lets me in.

(Verse 3)
Sunrise paints the mountain ridge, a fiery, bloody hue,
Another day of breakin' back, another debt to accrue.
The fields stretch out before me, endless rows of green,
But all I see is darkness, a fractured, broken scene.
This ain't the life I pictured,  beneath the mountain's gaze,
Just a broken boy, lost in a lonely, hazy maze.

(Bridge)
Mama's hymnals echo, a whisper in the wind,
A memory of comfort, a peace I can't pretend.
Will I ever feel that grace again, that gentle, lovin' hand?
Or am I destined to wander, a ghost in this promised land?

(Chorus)
Coal dust on the lamb, a stain that won't come clean,
Lost my way back home, a forgotten, faded scene.
These coal-stained hands, they hold the weight of sin,
Prayin' for redemption, hopin' God lets me in.

(Outro)
Lord, have mercy, on this coal-stained soul,
Lead me back to the fold, make me whole. 
Make me whole.

that_good_ol_90s_country.title: That Good Old 90s Country
that_good_ol_90s_country.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
1992, dirt roads and FM gold
George Strait on the radio, stories being told
Levi's worn thin, boots kicked up high
Chattahoochee memories under Georgia sky
[Verse 2]
Garth was king and Faith was rising
Brooks & Dunn kept dance floors flying
Shania showed us what a woman feels
When country music still had steel
[Chorus]
They don't make 'em like they did back then
When three chords and truth was more than just pretend
No Auto-Tune, no drum machines
Just real songs about real dreams
That good ol' 90s country
[Bridge]
Alan Jackson taught us how to live
Travis Tritt showed what love could give
And every small-town Friday night
Was pure country done just right
[Chorus]
They don't make 'em like they did back then
When three chords and truth was more than just pretend
No Auto-Tune, no drum machines
Just real songs about real dreams
That good ol' 90s country
[Outro]
Yeah, that good ol' 90s country
When the music meant something true
That good ol' 90s country
Still running straight through my blood
That good ol' 90s country

soul_food.title: Soul Food
soul_food.lyrics:
Verse 1
Walked through the door, grease poppin’ in the air,
Cornbread steamin’, love’s everywhere.
Mama’s in the kitchen, stirrin’ up a spell,
Plates piled high, where the heart can dwell.

Chorus
Soul food, oh, it’s lard and grace!
Fills my mind, my soul, my face!
From the skillet to the heart, it’s healin’ me whole,
Soul food, feedin’ body and soul!

Verse 2
Collard greens simmer, black-eyed peas sing,
Every bite’s a prayer, makes the spirit swing.
Round that table, laughin’, stories unfold,
Warmin’ up the weary, worth more than gold.

Chorus
Soul food, oh, it’s lard and grace!
Fills my mind, my soul, my face!
From the skillet to the heart, it’s healin’ me whole,
Soul food, feedin’ body and soul!

Bridge
Pass the biscuits, pour the gravy high,
Feel the love that lifts you to the sky!
In this sacred spot, where the good times roll,
Lard and grace gonna save your soul!

Chorus
Soul food, oh, it’s lard and grace!
Fills my mind, my soul, my face!
From the skillet to the heart, it’s healin’ me whole,
Soul food, feedin’ body and soul!

Outro
(Claps, hollers, gospel hum)
Soul food, yeah, it’s where I’m found,
Lard and grace, in that holy ground!

miles_of_sorrow.title: Miles of Sorrow
miles_of_sorrow.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sunrise paints the cotton fields, another day begins
But the light don't shine so bright, since your love went on the winds
We built a life on promises, beneath a Georgia moon
But your city dreams called louder, than my love could ever croon
(Chorus)
Miles of sorrow stretch between us, a highway paved with tears
Each mile a memory fading, swallowed by the passing years
We said forever, honey, but forever couldn't hold
Against the pull of distance, a story left untold
(Verse 2)
Remember dancin' in the hayloft, beneath the summer stars?
Your laughter like a mockingbird, escaping rusty bars
We swore our love was stronger, than any earthly pain
But the miles kept piling higher, a relentless, driving rain
(Chorus)
Miles of sorrow stretch between us, a highway paved with tears
Each mile a memory fading, swallowed by the passing years
We said forever, honey, but forever couldn't hold
Against the pull of distance, a story left untold
(Bridge)
I see your face in every sunset, hear your voice in every breeze
But the silence in this farmhouse, just echoes my unease
I shoulda held you tighter, darling, shoulda fought with all my might
But the distance won the battle, and stole away my light
(Chorus)
Miles of sorrow stretch between us, a highway paved with tears
Each mile a memory fading, swallowed by the passing years
We said forever, honey, but forever couldn't hold
Against the pull of distance, a story left untold
(Outro)
Miles of sorrow… miles and miles of sorrow…

miles_of_heartache.title: Miles of Heartache
miles_of_heartache.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sunrise paints the cotton fields, another day begins
But the light don't shine so bright no more, since you left for distant lands
Said you'd write, said you'd call, promised you'd always be near
But the miles stretched out between us, fueled by doubt and fear.
(Chorus)
Miles of heartache, winding roads of sorrow,
Every mile a memory, of a love we couldn't borrow
From the future, from the years, from a life we'd planned to share
Now just miles of heartache, and a love beyond repair.
(Verse 2)
Remember dancin' in the moonlight, beneath the summer sky?
Your laughter echoed in the fields, a song that made me fly.
We built a dream on promises, as solid as the ground
But the city lights and city life, tore our love unbound.
(Chorus)
Miles of heartache, winding roads of sorrow,
Every mile a memory, of a love we couldn't borrow
From the future, from the years, from a life we'd planned to share
Now just miles of heartache, and a love beyond repair.
(Bridge)
I keep your picture by my bed, a faded photograph
A constant reminder of the love, that distance stole, alas.
Maybe someday I'll forget, the pain that cuts so deep
But until then, these miles of heartache, are the only truth I keep.
(Chorus)
Miles of heartache, winding roads of sorrow,
Every mile a memory, of a love we couldn't borrow
From the future, from the years, from a life we'd planned to share
Now just miles of heartache, and a love beyond repair.
(Outro)
Miles… miles of heartache… yeah… gone…
